title: Drivers arrested as eight migrants found 'suffering from hypothermia' in lorry
text:
British Border Force guards reportedly made the find and told French authorities (Picture: Getty Images)

Eight Afghan migrants, including two young children, were found in the back of a refrigerated lorry in Calais this morning.

Two Romanian drivers were arrested at the French port at 5am as they tried to enter a ferry bound for the UK.

The are being held in custody tonight and are facing charges, having been accused of trying to smuggle people across the channel to England.

It comes after 25-year-old driver Maurice Robinson was arrested and charged with manslaughter after 39 dead migrants were found in the back of a lorry in Essex.

A source close to the most recent incident said: ‘The Aghans in the back of the truck were suffering from mild hypothermia.

The occupants were reportedly suffering from mild hypothermia (Picture: Getty Images)

‘It would have got far worse if they had remained in place, but they were taken to hospital in Calais for immediate treatment.’

The two Afghan children were described as ‘tiny infants’.

British Border Force guards reportedly found the stowaways and then called French authorities to arrest the drivers, reports MailOnline.

Prosecutors in Boulogne-sur-Mer, near Calais, confirmed the arrests and said the temperature inside the lorry would have been around 7C.

Authorities are yet to reveal the identities of the drivers or migrants on board and are trying to work out the route of the truck.

People smugglers regularly travel from Calais to Dover and charge up to £10,000 per person in the back of a lorry.

description: Two lorry drivers were arrested in Calais, France after being caught carrying Afghan migrants in a refrigerated container heading to the UK.
